content.description: Real-time NCAAM College Basketball scores on ESPN
content.keywords: NCAAM Scores, NCAAM scoreboard, College Basketball Scores, College Basketball scoreboard

headlines.description: Keita Bates-Diop had a career-high 32 points, and Ohio State stunned No. 1 Michigan State 80-64 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Over-achieving Ohio State stuns No. 1 Michigan State 80-64

tracking.trackingName: NCB One-Play (Buckeyes storm the court) 2018/1/7 ESHEET

headlines.description: Shannon Evans scored 22 points, and No. 4 Arizona State held on for a choppy 80-77 win over Utah on Sunday night to end a two-game losing streak.
headlines.shortLinkText: Evans scores 22, No. 4 Arizona State beats Utah 80-77

headlines.description: Shaquille Morris scored 15 points to lead a balanced scoring effort, and No. 9 Wichita State blew out South Florida 95-57 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 9 Wichita State crushes South Florida 95-57

headlines.description: Miami 5-foot-7 freshman Chris Lykes scored a season-high 18 points, and the No. 15 Hurricanes withstood a late rally by No. 24 Florida State to win 80-74 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Freshman Lykes helps No. 15 Miami beat No. 24 FSU 80-74

video.headline: Miami holds off Florida State rally

headlines.description: Jacob Evans III scored 18 points, and Gary Clark had a big second half as No. 19 Cincinnati pulled away to a 76-56 victory over SMU on Sunday, extending the longest active home-court winning streak in the country.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 19 Cincinnati overcomes poor shooting, beats SMU 76-56

video.headline: Bearcats hold SMU to a 20-point win

headlines.description: Dayon Griffin scored 15 points and UCF's top-10 ranked defense smothered Temple 60-39 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: UCF defense shuts down Temple 60-39

headlines.description: Jon Axel Gudmundsson hit four 3-pointers and scored 24 points and Davidson took control early for an 86-59 win over George Mason on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Gudmundsson scores 24, Davidson whips George Mason 86-59

headlines.description: Deyshonee Much scored a career-high 32 points to lead Iona to an 84-65 victory over Fairfield on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Much scores career-high 32 in Iona's 84-65 win

headlines.description: Phil Fayne and Milik Yarbrough scored 23 points each as Illinois State forced Missouri State into uncharacteristic turnovers, handing the Bears their first Missouri Valley Conference loss, 72-68, Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Illinois State hands Missouri State first MVC loss, 72-68

headlines.description: Zane Martin tossed in 16 points to lead five players in double figures and Towson dominated the first half in a 73-62 victory over Charleston on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Strong start leads Towson to 73-62 victory over Charleston

headlines.description: Matt Scott scored 23 points and Dominic Robb came off the bench to score all of his eight points in the paint during a comeback run in the second half as Niagara rallied to defeat Marist 86-70 Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Scott double-double helps Niagara rally past Marist 86-70

headlines.description: Nick Griffin hit five 3-pointers and scored 22 and Elijah Gonzales added 15 points and nine assists to power Saint Peter's to an 84-58 victory over Quinnipiac on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Saint Peter's rolls to 84-58 victory over Quinnipiac

headlines.description: Ryan Daly scored a season-high 27 points, Ryan Allen added 23 and the pair combined to make seven of Delaware's 11 3-pointers in a 96-76 victory over UNC Wilmington on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Daly, Allen score 20-plus, Delaware tops UNCW 96-76

headlines.description: Shawn Occeus made four 3-pointers and scored 18 points to help Northeastern beat James Madison 80-67 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Northeastern hits 14 3s, beats James Madison 80-67

headlines.description: Drew McDonald had 16 points and nine rebounds, and Lavone Holland II made a go-ahead jumper with 3.3 seconds left to give Northern Kentucky a 56-54 victory over Detroit Mercy on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Holland hits winner, Northern Kentucky edges Detroit Mercy

headlines.description: Loudon Love and Grant Benzinger posted double-doubles and Everett Winchester scored seven of his eight points in overtime to spark Wright State to an 86-81 victory over Oakland on Sunday afternoon.
headlines.shortLinkText: Winchester provides OT spark as Wright St tops Oakland 86-81

headlines.description: Jordan Horn hit a deep 3-pointer with 5.4 seconds on the clock and an answering trey by Jermaine Crumpton rattled in and out at the horn as Siena upended Canisius 65-62 on Sunday, handing the Golden Griffins their first conference loss.
headlines.shortLinkText: Horn's late 3 lifts Siena to 65-62 upset of Canisius

headlines.description: Clayton Custer scored 11 points and Ben Richardson hit a big 3-pointer to spark a late run as Loyola-Chicago rallied for a 56-50 victory over Northern Iowa on Sunday afternoon.
headlines.shortLinkText: Loyola-Chicago rallies late, tops Northern Iowa 56-50

headlines.description: David Cohn tied his season high with 26 points on 10-of-14 shooting and Nathan Knight finished with a double-double to propel William & Mary to an 85-63 victory over Drexel on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: William & Mary cruises to 85-63 victory over Drexel

headlines.description: Tyler Seibring scored 22 points and all the Elon starters reached double figures in an 89-76 victory over Hofstra on Sunday, overcoming a career-high 39 points by Justin Wright-Foreman.
headlines.shortLinkText: All 5 Elon starters in double figures in 89-76 triumph

headlines.description: Tyere Marshall and Frederick Scott combined for 39 points and 27 rebounds to lead Rider past Manhattan for an 82-76 win Sunday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Rider rallies in second half for 82-76 win over Manhattan

headlines.description: Freshman Bruno Fernando scored a career-high 21 points, Anthony Cowan Jr. added 15 and Maryland beat Iowa 91-73 Sunday night to keep the Hawkeyes winless in the Big Ten.
headlines.shortLinkText: Maryland uses second-half surge to beat Iowa 91-73

video.headline: Fernando leaves Maryland bench in shock with alley-oop

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One-Play (Fernando leaves Maryland bench in shock with alley-oop) 2018/01/07 ESHEET

headlines.description: Deajon Davis hit a desperation 50-foot 3-pointer at the buzzer and Stanford shocked USC 77-76 on Sunday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Davis hits 50-footer to lift Stanford past Trojans, 77-76

video.headline: Stanford beats USC on half-court buzzer-beater

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One-Play (Stanford beats USC on half-court buzzer-beater) 2018/01/07 ESHEET

nowFeed.headline: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.
nowFeed.story: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.

nowFeed.headline: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops https://t.co/aMhklA2Vbl
nowFeed.story: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops vimeo.com/256137612

nowFeed.headline: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.
nowFeed.story: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.

nowFeed.headline:
The race for the No. 1 seeds is more wide open now after a few recent upsets. Per BPI, here's where we stand:

Virginia 99%
Villanova 98%
Purdue 71%
Michigan State 52%
Xavier 32%
Duke 29%
North Carolina 9%
Tennessee 4%
Auburn 3%
Kansas 2%

nowFeed.headline: Houston coach Kelvin Sampson said "good teams should win at home," including his Cougars, who are 13-0 this season at home, including Thursday's 67-62 upset of No. 5 Cincinnati.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.

nowFeed.headline: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.
nowFeed.story: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.

nowFeed.headline: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.
nowFeed.story: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
